Elliotte Harold wrote:
> ... Structured data is a crutch invented by computer scientists
> because they don't have computers as powerful as a human brain. Tables,
> maps, list, trees and more are all kludges designed to try to make some
> sense out of an unordered, unstructured world.

anarchist

> ...There are many, many examples where JSON (and other map-list
> data structures) becomes practically unmanageable but which XML handles
> without blinking.

I don't doubt you, but can you provide some concrete examples, rather 
than just claim there are "many, many" of them?

-- 
Patrick Mueller
http://muellerware.org
